intro: Hetaeria micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered hetaeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have a distinctive coloration with contrasting hues. The leaves are simple, opposite, and usually have a waxy texture, contributing to its adaptability in various environmental conditions.
